@jmseiko #Vision promised in 2009 to do better. @MayorGregor broke promise 2 plan 4 clearing roads in extreme weather. We need a plan!
@MikeoftheWest do u agree its an emergency when ppl with disabilities & seniors are stranded, when taxis & handiDART can't get 2 them! I DO
@BradenMcMill @drex @CityofVancouver today staff couldn't confirm confirm amount left. Told me more is coming tomorrow. I did the math.
@mforsis @CityofVancouver contributes 2 budget for emergency preparedness to help all in need. Same should apply 4 extreme weather.
@MikeoftheWest Clear roads/ public spaces not political issue. It's a safety issue. I don't view earthquake prep & drills as "political"
@ReneeStephen I agree. Those who can should shovel & salt. Hypocritical of city 2 issue fines when they aren't clearing public roads/spaces
@ReneeStephen the City of Vancouver owns plenty of land..including large pieces of fenced land & industrial, appropriate for storing salt
@ReneeStephen from history we can expect every 5-7 years to have an extreme cold weather period. We should add to our reserves each year
